title: Maryland Rep. Jamie Raskin passes on Senate, announces House reelection run
description: Raskin gave himself until July to announce his plans. He was weighing a reelection campaign against a run for the U.S. Senate. He went into remission for cancer in April.

title: The U.S. is sending cluster bombs to Ukraine despite humanitarian warnings
description: U.S. officials maintained Friday that Ukraine has provided written assurances to minimize civilian casualties with the use of the controversial munitions.

title: The world is officially 'free' of chemical weapons. Here's what that means
description: The U.S. has destroyed the last of its stockpile of sarin nerve agent, fulfilling a decades-old obligation.

title: The job market is cooling but still surprisingly strong. Is that a good thing?
description: U.S. employers added 209,000 jobs in June. That's a solid number, but fewer than the month before. Here are the 5 things we took away from the report.

title: Twitter threatens to sue its new rival, Threads, claiming Meta stole trade secrets
description: An attorney for Twitter accused Meta of hiring dozens of former Twitter employees with the intention of creating a "copycat" platform, implying a lawsuit could come next.

title: Gold Star families allegedly defrauded of death benefits by adviser
description: A major in the Army Reserves and financial counselor with the Army allegedly used his access to beneficiaries of deceased servicemembers to defraud them and enrich himself, prosecutors allege.

title: He had a plane to himself after an 18-hour delay. What happened next was a wild ride
description: Phil Stringer was the only passenger on his long-delayed flight from Oklahoma City to Charlotte, N.C. He credits crew members for their positive attitude — and is planning a trip to visit them soon.

title: Special counsel has spent millions investigating Trump
description: Special counsel Jack Smith has spent more than $5 million so far on his twin investigations that circle former President Trump.

title: The U.S. added 209,000 jobs in June, showing that hiring is slowing but still solid
description: U.S. employers added 209,000 jobs in June, marking another respectable month of job growth, though it was slower than in previous months.

title: Up First Briefing: Alzheimer's drug; Ukraine cluster bombs; tap water chemicals
description: The FDA approved the first drug shown to slow down Alzheimer's. The Biden administration will send controversial cluster bombs to Ukraine. A study estimates PFAS is in nearly half of U.S. tap water.

title: What to know about the drug price fight in those TV ads
description: At least nine bills introduced in Congress take aim at pharmacy benefit managers, the powerful middlemen that channel prescription drugs to patients. Here's what the fuss is all about.

title: After days of destruction, Macron blames a familiar bogeyman: video games
description: Violence has erupted across France after the fatal police shooting of a teen. President Macron has, in part, blamed video games, adding him to the list of leaders who have cited the debunked theory.

title: Against all odds, the rare Devils Hole pupfish keeps on swimming
description: The Devils Hole pupfish's natural habitat is a single water-filled hole in a cave in the Nevada desert. Its numbers at one point dwindled to just 35 animals. How does it manage to survive?

title: The CDC is helping states address gun injuries after years of political roadblocks
description: A grant program gives states a path around a 1996 federal rule that prohibits the CDC from advocating gun control — a rule critics say has had a chilling effect on studying who has been shot and how.

title: Climate change is our reality — so why wouldn't it appear on reality TV?
description: Scenes modeling sustainable behaviors or highlighting the impact of climate change have been cropping up lately in everything from cooking shows to extreme sports series.

title: An Iowa teenager receives life for the beating death of his high school teacher
description: The first of two Iowa teenagers who pleaded guilty to beating their high school Spanish teacher to death with a baseball bat was sentenced to life with a chance of parole after 35 years in prison.

title: OceanGate suspends its commercial and exploration operations after Titan implosion
description: OceanGate did not offer additional details about pausing its operations. Its CEO, Stockton Rush, was among the five people killed when the company's Titan submersible imploded in June.
